meanings.definition: The process of moving or positioning something to the side.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the coach emphasized the importance of lateralizations in basketball.
meanings.sent2: The lateralizations of the shelves in the store made it easier for customers to browse.
meanings.sent3: The lateralizations of the penguins waddling sideways brought a smile to the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her lateralizations in decision-making led her down unexpected paths.
meanings.sent5: The lateralizations of the road signs guided the drivers safely through the city.

meanings.definition: The act of making something lateral in direction or position.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers focused on the lateralizations of the fence to ensure it stood straight.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the lateralizations of the equipment to fit them into the limited space.
meanings.sent3: The lateralizations of the trees in the wind created a mesmerizing dance in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The lateralizations of the planets around the sun fascinated the young astronomer.
meanings.sent5: The lateralizations of the furniture in the room gave it a spacious and organized feel.
